Key Match Events: Shaheen Shah Afridi helps Pakistan end on a high
Shaheen Shah Afridi hits a six as he helped Pakistan over the finish line in Florida
Babar Azam guided Pakistan through a nervy chase
Shaheen Shah Afridi (3-22) dismissed Andrew Balbirnie and Lorcan Tucker in the first over
Ireland's Gareth Delany (31 off 19 balls) helped stabilise Ireland’s innings
Imad Wasim (3-8) before an unbeaten last-wicket partnership of 26 runs between Joshua Little (22 not out) and Benjamin White (5 not out) got them to 106-9
Usman Khan and Shadab Khan in the same over, leaving Pakistan looking shaky at 57-5
Barry McCarthy (3-15) dismissed Usman Khan and Shadab Khan in the same over
Shaheen Shah Afridi and Babar Azam helped Pakistan to a three-wicket win
Shaheen Shah Afridi sealed the deal with his second six of Delany’s over

Pre-Game Insights: Shaheen Shah Afridi: “As usual I’m trying to strike early on, I followed my plan. We did a good job as bowling unit.”
Pakistan need 5.35 an over to win – I’ll be back as soon as the kettle has boiled to take you through their chase.
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Stirling: “We played well in patches. They blew our top order away but I’m proud of the fight that we’ve shown. We’ll go back and regroup and get better in the months and years to come.”
Babar: “ We have some close games but we didn’t’ finish well. We have some good indivduals but we didn’t play well as a team.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ireland finished bottom with one point from the washout against Canada, ending their campaign without a win.
Pakistan must now return home to an unhappy nation, Ireland also to lick their wounds.
Ireland, however, finish bottom, only taking one point from the tournament after three losses and that no result against Canada.
Lauderhill’s Central Broward Park stadium finally saw a match completed after three of its previous games were washed out.
